intro: Coreopsis lanceolata, commonly known as narrowleaf coreopsis, is a flowering plant native to the eastern and central United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and orange. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 feet and has narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardeners seeking low-maintenance, ornamental plants. Its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies adds ecological value to the landscape.
